name: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania v. William J. BARTRAM, Jr., Appellant

judges: Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDERMOTT, ZAPPALA, PAPADAKOS and CAPPY, JJ.
LARSEN and McDERMOTT, JJ., did not participate in the consideration or decision of this case.
parties: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania v. William J. BARTRAM, Jr., Appellant.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
Appeal dismissed as having been improvidently granted.
LARSEN and McDERMOTT, JJ., did not participate in the consideration or decision of this case.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: John B. Nicklas, Jr., Donald J. Strunk, McCrady & Nicklas, W. Thomas McGough, Jr., Reed Smith Shaw & McClay, Pittsburgh, for appellant.
Richard A. Linzer, Craig A. Chamberlain, Office of the Attorney General, Greensburg, Andrea F. McKenna, Office of the Attorney General, Harrisburg, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
570 A.2d 1318
COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania v. William J. BARTRAM, Jr., Appellant.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued March 9, 1990.
Decided March 21, 1990.
John B. Nicklas, Jr., Donald J. Strunk, McCrady & Nicklas, W. Thomas McGough, Jr., Reed Smith Shaw & McClay, Pittsburgh, for appellant.
Richard A. Linzer, Craig A. Chamberlain, Office of the Attorney General, Greensburg, Andrea F. McKenna, Office of the Attorney General, Harrisburg, for appellee.
Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDERMOTT, ZAPPALA, PAPADAKOS and CAPPY, JJ.
